PRU-ICSS Resources

This page is still in development. For now, visit http://elinux.org/Ti_AM33XX_PRUSSv2.

PRU Workshop

Materials from the PRU workshop held at the SE Michigan BeagleBone Users' Group meetup will be uploaded here shortly.

Workshop videos

Help in editing this videos, by combining them into one, switching screens at the right point, adding annotations and indexing, would be very welcome.

Slides

Steps

  1. Flash the BeagleBone with the provided build, and boot it up.
  2. Go to Cloud-9 - http://192.168.7.2:3000/
  3. nano /boot/uEnv.txt (nano editor of the /boot/uEnv.txt file)
    - edit, remove ‘#’ on ?
  4. shutdown –r now (restarts the BeagleBone)
  5. modprobe pru_speak (back in Cloud-9)
  6. config-pin overlay BB-PRUSPEAK - device tree source file
    - this the remote proc server, which loads firmware and manages communication between files and the PRU. It is placed inthe OS Kernel.
  7. dhclient eth0 (in a separate Cloud-9 subwindow) - to connect obtain an IP address for the BeagleBone if necessary
  8. pip install ply
  9. run tcp server
  10. netcat localhost 6060 – port to
    PRU Speak should now be running
  11. Place an LED w/resistor in the P8 pins closest to the ethernet cable in the x positions (note the LED does have a direction) .X
    ..
    X.
  12. Execute SET DIO[4],1 in PRU Speak to turn the LED on.
